author: Staff Reporter
text:
A four-day Hungarian film festival will begin at the Russian Centre of Science and Culture on March 28.

According to a press release, the festival is jointly organised by the Indo Cine Appreciation Foundation and New Delhi-based Balassi Institute, a Hungarian Information and Cultural Centre. Some of Hungarian films that will be screened are Made in Hungaria, Swing, Just Sex and Nothing Else, Heavenly Shift and Freedom Flight .

The films will be screened from 6 p.m. onwards. The Centre is located at 74, Kasthuri Ranga Road, Alwarpet. For details, call 044-28212652.
title: Hungarian film festival
